DOC.brief_summary: Contrast-induced nephropathy ( CIN ) well-recognized complication radiographic contrast administration associate increase short- long-term mortality . Previous strategy include forced diuresis diuretic mannitol , intravenous administration fenoldopam dobutamine , postprocedure hemodialysis prevent CIN largely unsuccessful . In addition , use N-acetylcysteine prevent CIN yield conflict outcomes . A review large insurance database retrospective study show statin therapy associate low incidence CIN percutaneous coronary intervention . The preventive effect statin CIN may attribute direct pleiotropic effect vascular wall improvement endothelial dysfunction , anti-inflammatory anti-oxidative effect . However , recent randomize trial could demonstrate preventive effect statin CIN patient chronic kidney disease . Thus , investigate preventive effect pitavastatin CIN patient renal dysfunction undergo coronary angiography intervention .
DOC.brief_title: Preventive Effect Pitavastatin Contrast-Induced Nephropathy Patients With Renal Dysfunction
DOC.criteria: Age ≥ 19 year Need coronary angiography intervention patient typical symptom angina myocardial infarction , document myocardial ischemia noninvasive study include ECG , treadmill ECG test , heart spect coronary CT angiography Estimated glomerular filtration rate ≤60 mL/min Informed consent Need primary percutaneous coronary intervention emergent intervention patient myocardial infarction Allergic reaction contrast agent ( Visipaque ) statin Contraindication contrast agent ( Visipaque ) statin Shock status fron cause include cardiogenic shock Statin use enrollment ( Enrollment 2 week washout period ) Exposure contrast agent within 7 day enrollment Pregnancy Expectation pregnancy woman childbearing age Heart failure ( NYHA class ≥3 leave ventricular ejection fraction < 40 % ) Acute renal injury Dialysis therapy Mechanical ventilator Life expectancy < 6 month Nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug , dopamine , mannitol Nacetylcysteine , ascorbic acid within 48 hour coronary angiography/intervention Severe hepatic dysfunction Eisenmenger syndrome idiopathic pulmonary hypertension Renal artery angioplasty within 6 month Single function kidney Kidney transplantation
